Lyrics: Como ũu clérigo ena missa consomiu ũa aranna que lle caeu no cález, e andava-lle ontr' o coiro e a carne viva, e fez Santa María que lle saísse pela unna.
Direct Translation: How a priest during mass ate a spider which fell into the chalice. It crawled about between his skin and the living flesh, and Holy Mary caused it to come out through his fingernail.

Lyrics: Muito bon miragr' a Virgen | faz estranno e fremoso,
Direct Translation: The Virgin performs many rare and beautiful miracles
Poetic Translation: Mighty is the Virgin, Who makes lovely miracles to show it,

Lyrics: porque a verdad' entenda | o neicío perfïoso.
Direct Translation: so that the doubting fool may come to know the truth.
Poetic Translation: So the fool who's lost and doubting may perceive the truth and know it.

Lyrics: E daquest' un gran miragre | vos será per mi contado,
Direct Translation: Of this, I shall tell you a great miracle,
Poetic Translation: I will tell you all about it, this great deed, a wonder truly.

Lyrics: e d' oír maravilloso, | pois oíde-o de grado,
Direct Translation: marvelous to hear, so listen intently.
Poetic Translation: It is marvelous and dreadful to the ear, so listen duly,

Lyrics: que mostrou a Santa Virgen, | de que Déus por nós foi nado,
Direct Translation: The Holy Virgin of whom God was born for our sake performed it
Poetic Translation: Rendered by the Holy Virgin Who bore God for us unruly.

Lyrics: dentro en Cidad-Rodrigo. | E é mui maravilloso
Direct Translation: in Ciudad Rodrigo. Among all the other miracles
Poetic Translation: There in Ciudad Rodrigo unto us did She bestow it.

Lyrics: Ontr' os outros que oístes, | e tenn' éu que atal éste
Direct Translation: you have heard, I hold the one I shall tell you now
Poetic Translation: All the miracles you've heard of, if compared to one another,

Lyrics: o que vos contarei óra | que avẽo a un préste
Direct Translation: to be the most remarkable. It happened to a priest
Poetic Translation: Could not be as strange as this one, more unique than any other.

Lyrics: que dizía sempre missa | da Madre do Rei celéste;
Direct Translation: who always said mass of the Mother of the Heavenly King.
Poetic Translation: Here's what happened to a priest who sang the mass of Christ's own Mother.

Lyrics: e porque a ben cantava, | éra ên mui desejoso
Direct Translation: Because he sang it well, the people
Poetic Translation: He was known as quite the singer; Sweetly would his voice intone it.

Lyrics: O póblo de lla oíren. | Mas un día, sen falida,
Direct Translation: were very eager to hear him sing it. However, one day, I swear,
Poetic Translation: But one day, I swear, in August, on the Feast of the Assumption,

Lyrics: ena gran fésta d' Agosto, | desta Sennor mui comprida
Direct Translation: in the great festival of August*,
Poetic Translation: Mass to this Most Perfect Lady in his song had its resumption.

Lyrics: estava cantando missa; | e pois ouve consomida
Direct Translation: he was singing the mass of this Most Perfect Lady. After he had eaten
Poetic Translation: After all his incantations and the Sacred Host's consumption,

Lyrics: a Ósti', ar quis o sángui | consomir do glorïoso
Direct Translation: the Host, he then began to drink the Blood of the Glorious
Poetic Translation: He began to drink the Blood of Jesus Christ and to extol it.

Lyrics: Jesú-Crist'. E viu no cáliz | jazer ũa grand' aranna
Direct Translation: Jesus Christ. He saw in the chalice a large spider
Poetic Translation: Then he saw that in the chalice an enormous spider clambered

Lyrics: dentro no sángui nadando, | e teve-o por estranna
Direct Translation: swimming in the Blood, and he thought it a curious
Poetic Translation: Through the Blood, the strangest wonder, and his heart intensely hammered.

Lyrics: cousa; mais mui grand' esforço | fillou, a fóro d' Espanna,
Direct Translation: thing. However, he gathered courage, like a true Spaniard,
Poetic Translation: But he gathered all his courage, like a true and noble Spaniard,

Lyrics: e de consomir-lo todo | non vos foi mui vagaroso.
Direct Translation: and lost no time in drinking it down.
Poetic Translation: And he swallowed Blood and spider; down his tender throat it floated.

Lyrics: E pois aquest' ouve feito, | non quis que ll' empeecesse
Direct Translation: After he had done this, God did not allow the venom
Poetic Translation: After he had drunk the spider, and it crawled around inside him,

Lyrics: Déus o poçôn da aranna | nen lle no córpo morresse;
Direct Translation: of the spider to poison him nor his body to die.
Poetic Translation: God did not allow its venom to infect his flesh and blight him.

Lyrics: e pero andava viva, | non ar quis que o mordesse,
Direct Translation: Although it was alive, He did not let it bite him,
Poetic Translation: Though it was alive an dmoving, God would never let it bite him,

Lyrics: mas ontr' o coir' e a carn' ía | aquel bestigo astroso.
Direct Translation: but that loathsome beast crawled about under his skin.
Poetic Translation: But beneath his supple skin there was a crawling bulge to show it.

Lyrics: E andava muit' aginna | pelo córp' e non fazía
Direct Translation: It rapidly went through his body and caused
Poetic Translation: Never causing him pain or harm, though it was never stationary,

Lyrics: door nen mal, por vertude | da Virgen Santa María;
Direct Translation: no pain or harm, because of the power of the Holy Virgin Mary.
Poetic Translation: Was the spider, through the power of the Holy Virgin Mary.

Lyrics: e se s' ao sól parava, | lóg' a aranna viía,
Direct Translation: If he stood in the sunlight, he could see the spider.
Poetic Translation: When he stood in sunlight, he could see the spider, huge and hairy,

Lyrics: e mostrando-a a todos | dizend': "O Rei pïadoso
Direct Translation: He showed it to all the people, saying: "The merciful King
Poetic Translation: Through his skin so fair and lucent. He to all the people showed it,

Lyrics: Quis que polos méus pecados | aqueste marteir' ouvésse;
Direct Translation: "willed that I endure this martyrdom because of my sins.
Poetic Translation: Saying, "God makes me a martyr for my sinning, cold and greedy,

Lyrics: porên rógo aa Virgen | que se a ela prouguésse,
Direct Translation: Therefore, I pray to the Virgin that, if it be Her pleasure,
Poetic Translation: So I pray unto the Virgin and I make Her this entreaty

Lyrics: que rogass' ao séu Fillo | que cedo mi a mórte désse
Direct Translation: She pray to Her Son to give me a speedy death
Poetic Translation: That She ask Her Son to give me soon my death and make it speedy

Lyrics: ou me tolless' esta coita, | ca ben é ên poderoso."
Direct Translation: or remove this suffering from me, for He has the power to do so."
Poetic Translation: Or remove this anguish from me. He can save me, and I know it."

Lyrics: Esta aranna andando | per cima do espinnaço
Direct Translation: This spider crawled up his spine
Poetic Translation: Up his spine the hateful spider crept, exultant and appalling;

Lyrics: e depois pelos costados | e en dereito do baço,
Direct Translation: and down his sides and along his spleen
Poetic Translation: Down along his spleen and to his chest and stomach it went crawling.

Lyrics: des i ía-ll' aos peitos | e sól non leixava braço
Direct Translation: and from there to his chest. It did not fail to travel
Poetic Translation: Up his right arm and his left, it went without so much as stalling

Lyrics: per que assí non andasse; | e o córpo mui veloso
Direct Translation: up both arms. Morover, this spider
Poetic Translation: With its very hairy body, such that anyone would loathe it.

Lyrics: Avía esta aranna. | E un día, el estando
Direct Translation: had  a very hairy body. One day while he was sitting
Poetic Translation: Then one day at nones he rested, in the sunshine calmly sitting,

Lyrics: ao sól, óra de nõa, | foi ll' o braç' escaentando,
Direct Translation: in the sun, at the hour of nones, his arm began to tingle,
Poetic Translation: When his arm began to tingle with a tickle unremitting,

Lyrics: e el a coçar fillou-s' e | non catou al senôn quando
Direct Translation: and he began to scratch it. Before he knew what was happening,
Poetic Translation: So he scratched. Before he knew it, suddenly his skin was splitting.

Lyrics: lle saiu per so a unlla | aquel poçôn tan lixoso.
Direct Translation: that noxious creature came out of him from under his fingernail.
Poetic Translation: From beneath his fingernail crawled out the spider, foul and bloated.

Lyrics: E tan tóste que saída | foi, o crérigo fillou-a
Direct Translation: As soon as it had come out, the priest caught it
Poetic Translation: Just as it squeezed out, he caught it, and he could not be evaded;

Lyrics: e fez lógo dela póos | e en sa bolssa guardou-a;
Direct Translation: and pulverized it and placed it in his wallet.
Poetic Translation: Then he swiftly pulverized it and he in his wallet laid it.

Lyrics: e quando disse sa missa, | consumiu-a e passou-a,
Direct Translation: When he said his mass, he ate it and swallowed it
Poetic Translation: When he said his mass that Sunday, then with tranquil face he ate it.

Lyrics: e disse que lle soubéra | a manjar mui saboroso.
Direct Translation: and said it tasted like delicious food to him.
Poetic Translation: It was swallowed down like food, and its delicious taste he noted.

Lyrics: As gentes que i estavan, | quand' ouvéron esto visto,
Direct Translation: The people who were there, when they had seen this,
Poetic Translation: When the people saw him stand there free of damage and diseases,

Lyrics: loaron muito a Madre | do Santo Rei Jesú-Cristo;
Direct Translation: praised the Mother of the Holy Jesus Christ.
Poetic Translation: They gave praise to Holy Mary, Mother of our Savior Jesus.

Lyrics: e des alí adeante | foi o crérigo por isto
Direct Translation: From that time on, the priest was much
Poetic Translation: From that day, the priest was righteous, doing as Our Father pleases,

Lyrics: mui mais na fé confirmado, | e non foi luxurïoso.
Direct Translation: firmer in his faith and not guilty of lustfulness.
Poetic Translation: Never greedy, never lustful, firmly to his faith devoted.
